result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald L Hubbard Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing Hearing on Revocation held on 1/1/16 before Judge Koschnick
Email from DOC Cashiers Unit with balance information

Cases 14CF366 and 15CM307 called together at 1:35pm [mo]
As to Case 14CF366(Sentencing Hearing on Revocation occurs) and As to Case 15CM307(Sentencing Hearing occurs)
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On revocation order and warrant of Case 14CF366; no factual corrections
--Atty. Dahnert raises the accuracy of prior criminal record

As to Case 15CM307:The Court finds that Defendant has been properly been charged as a repeater

As to Both Cases: 
Sentencing arguments made by Counsel
--Statement made by B.K.
--Statement made by Mr. Hubbard

As to Case 15CM307:
The Court sentences Mr. Hubbard to 2 years of Incarceration, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision 6 months. 
This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp". 
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. The Court gives 137 days credit for time already served. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision: 
--Complete a Certified Batterers Intervention and follow throught as recommended; this is to be made available to Mr. Hubbard during confinement period
--to pay Court Costs
--to provide a DNA sample
--No Contact with the victim,
--No presence within 1000 feet of the victim's residence, place of employment or place of education

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant


As to Case 14CF366:
On Count #3 the Court sentences Defendant to: 
--serve 9 months in the County Jail, concurrent to sentence in Counts #4 and #5 and concurrent to the sentence in case 15CM307

On Count #4 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90 days in the County Jail, concurrent to sentence in Counts #3 and #5 and concurrent to the sentence in case 15CM307

On Count #5 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in the County Jail, concurrent to sentence in Counts #3 and #4 and concurrent to the sentence in case 15CM307

--As to Case 14CF366 the Court orders all costs and fees to be coverted to civil judgement against Mr. Hubbard
--137 days credit for time already served given 
recess: 2:15pm
Attorney Dahnert
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 01-14-2016 01:30 pm
Scheduling notice

Case called at 2:58 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for sentencing after revocation)
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court, in-custody. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court informs Mr. Hubbard that It has been awaiting for Counsel to appear. Explains to Mr. Hubbard that Atty Svehlek was Counsel in the past, but would need to reapply for this case, as when the case is closed, that SPD closes their file. Indicates that there may have been some confusion as there is an open case where Atty Dahnert has been appointed by SPD, but an application does need to be completed for each case. 
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Hubbard indicates that he would like Counsel in this case
Court explains appointment of SPD - adjourns hearing and informs Mr. Hubbard to inform the Deputies that he would like to speak with SPD
Recess: 3:02 pm

NEXT: Reschedule Sentencing After Revocation 1/14/16 at 1:30 pm - Send notices

Case called at 10:08am [MO & MK]
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Courts amends #5 to Class B misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct contrary to statute 947.01(1)

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #3, #4, #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 and #2*.

During the sentencing portion of the hearing, a statement is made by the victim B.K. requesting for Mr. Hubbard to have contact with her. 

On Count #3, #4, #5, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to undergo either certified batterers intervention or anger management, one or the other, which one to be determined by the Agent
--not to commit acts or threats of violence
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling required by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #5: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court grants the Defense request for expungement of this case, under statute 973.015, conditioned on Mr. Hubbard successfully completing probation term
